# Materials for today

Materials for today can be found at [https://nrennie.rbind.io/training-git-r/](https://nrennie.rbind.io/training-git-r/)

<br>

To follow along today you will need the following things:

- RStudio and Git installed:  [https://happygitwithr.com/install-git](https://happygitwithr.com/install-git)
- `usethis` and `gitcreds` packages installed


# What is R-Ladies? {.smaller}

-   R-Ladies is a world-wide organization with the mission of promoting **gender diversity in the R community**

-   Started in San Francisco in 2012 and now has **225 chapters** globally (check out [rladies.org](https://rladies.org/) for more information)

-   R-Ladies is rebranding to `R-Ladies+` in order to be more inclusive of all underrepresented genders in the R community. You can read more about this transition [here](https://rladies.org/news/rebranding-rladies/).

# About today's speaker

- Nicola Rennie is a data visualisation specialist with a background in statistics and data science. 
- As of recently she is now working at the Office of National Statistics in Scotland.
- She’s interested in understanding how to effectively communicate complex quantitative ideas in an accessible way, as well as how to do so using open source tools.
- She co-authored the Royal Statistical Society’s Best Practices for Data Visualisation guidance.
- She’s also previously been a committee member of the R-Ladies Global Team.
